com.aylanetworks.aylasdk.error

类 RequestFuture<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aylanetworks.aylasdk.error.RequestFuture<T>
  • 类型参数:
    T - The type of parsed response this future expects.
    所有已实现的接口:
    com.android.volley.Response.Listener<T>, ErrorListener, java.util.concurrent.Future<T>

    public class RequestFuture<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.concurrent.Future<T>, com.android.volley.Response.Listener<T>, ErrorListener
    A Future that represents an AylaAPIRequest. Futures allow the asynchronous APIs of the SDK to be accessed synchronously. To use a RequestFuture, first create an instance of the appropriate generic type for the API method. The future object may be passed to the SDK method as both the success and error listener arguments. To wait for the result of the asynchronous operation, simply call get() on the future, which will block until one of the listeners have been called. If the operation was successful, the call to get() will return the object created by the SDK. If the operation failed, the method will throw an ExecutionException whose inner exception contains the AylaError describing the cause of failure.

    Used by providing as your response and error listeners. For example: 

     RequestFuture<JSONObject> future = RequestFuture.newFuture();
 MyRequest request = new MyRequest(URL, future, future);

 // If you want to be able to cancel the request:
 future.setRequest(requestQueue.add(request));

 // Otherwise:
 requestQueue.add(request);

 try {
   JSONObject response = future.get();
   // do something with response
 } catch (InterruptedException e) {
   // handle the error
 } catch (ExecutionException e) {
   // handle the error
 }
